title: Grilled Tuna Steaks With Potato And Green Bean Salad
summary: Grilled Tuna Steaks With Potato And Green Bean Salad might be just the main course you are searching for. For $7.91 per serving, this recipe covers 58% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 697 calories, 54g of protein, and 36g of fat. This recipe serves 4. If you have potatoes, basil leaves, pine nuts, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the lemon peel you could follow this main course with the Lemon Syrup Cake with Berries and Lemon-Curd Cream as a dessert. Only a few people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. The Fourth Of July will be even more special with this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 38 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and pescatarian diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 89%. This score is tremendous. winePairing.pairingText: Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine are great choices for Tuna. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. The Nickel & Nickel Harris Vineyard Merlot with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 40 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Nickel & Nickel Harris Vineyard Merlot
productMatches.description: Bright red fruits, candied blueberry, Santa Rosa plum and menthol aromas all blend together to intoxicate the nose as the 2016 Harris Vineyard Merlot wafts from the glass. On the palate, a juicy and fruity entry is supported by chewy tannins and a balancing acidity, creating lush layers that coat the tongue and produce a soft, elegant finish.
